intro: Dortmanna corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, riverbanks, and roadside ditches. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and often covered with fine hairs. Dortmanna corymbosa is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from June to August, attracting various pollinators with its nectar-rich flowers.
